text:
Late to the party but you can clone the var by adding `[:]` to the end
This should be the only change to your original code
```{% set bp = default_block_presets[:] %}```
I’m sure this used to be in the dev docs (there was also a |clone or .clone but that didn’t always work for me)
Oh the link to copy doesn’t work its’s the .copy one…

Hey there!

You can use the Default Template variables for HubL found here:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables>

However, if you cannot find what you are looking for, you can also create your own HubL variables here:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables-macros-syntax>

HubL variables may be something you code but they are just as reliable as the ID and objects and reliant on the same frameworks in the background.

Hope this helps! :simple_smile:
`[:]` doesn’t work for me. It says “Property default_block_presets is not a sequence.” :disappointed:
Testing further and it seems .copy() works too, but again, only with a sequence.
